name: Path N NET Rectum
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1**: Histological examination of a regional lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 12 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met. classify as pN0. 

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in distant metastasis.

**Regional lymph nodes for rectosigmoid junction and rectum**
    
**All sites:** 

    Hemorrhoidal (middle, superior) 
    Inferior mesenteric 
    Mesenteric [NOS] 
    Perirectal 
    Rectal (middle) 
    Rectal [NOS] 
    Rectal (superior) 
    Rectosigmoid (paracolic/pericolic)
    Sigmoidal (sigmoid mesenteric)

**Rectosigmoid (C199)** 

    Colic, (NOS) 
    Left colic
  
**Rectum (C209)** 

    Hemorrhoidal (inferior) 
    Internal iliac (hypogastric)  
    Lateral (laterosacral) 
    Middle (promontorial) (Gerota's node) 
    Obturator
    Presacral
    Rectal (inferior) 
    Sacral (NOS)
    Sacral promontory
rows: Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed

Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes is done but involvement of regional nodes not stated
Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes is done but involvement of regional nodes not documented in patient record

Nodule(s) or foci in perirectal fat

Regional lymph node(s), NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1

Pathologic N is not defined for this site/histology
In situ (no Tis defined)

No pathologic evaluation of regional lymph nodes
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed pathologically
No resection of the primary
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
